txt.en: For the Love of Honey Cakes
TBD

'You think it was reckless to send Vaskorn by himself? Well... perhaps so. My mind was very much on my baking, you see, and it seemed sensible enough at the time. 

'Every once in a while, one Beorning is not enough for the task. I do not think we are too late. We should help him. He thinks very highly of you, [placeholder], so I will trust you. You have seen what we are up against, after all. You may lead us to their camp.

'Here is my plan: you return to the brown wizard and bring back this potion of his, while I will get the others prepared for the outing.'
DNT - Speak with Beorning Lieutenant #2

'Your timing is remarkable, [placeholder]. The honey cakes have just finished baking. I may set them to cool properly while we deal with these bothersome Ungoledain.\n\n'You may give the poison protection to Fiskvat and Hunulf, while I set the honey cakes out to cool. We share a fence, and therefore trust.'
'Threkmóth is not a bad sort, really, though sometimes I think he cares more for honey cakes than his folk, or anyone else for that matter.'
Return to Threkmóth
Deliver Radagast's potion to Hunulf
'Your help is most welcome, [placeholder]. Vaskorn is my brother. I would have run off to stand by his side sooner, if I had known.'

#-1:[placeholder]'You think it was reckless to send Vaskorn by himself? Well... perhaps so. My mind was very much on my baking, you see, and it seemed sensible enough at the time. 

'Every once in a while, one Beorning is not enough for the task. I do not think we are too late. We should help him. He thinks very highly of you, #-1:{sister[f]|brother}, so I will trust you. You have seen what we are up against, after all. You may lead us to their camp.

'Here is my plan: you return to the brown wizard and bring back this potion of his, while I will get the others prepared for the outing.'
Deliver Radagast's potion to Fiskvat
#-1:[placeholder]'Your help is most welcome, #-1:{sister[f]|brother}. Vaskorn is my brother.  I would have run off to stand by his side sooner, if I had known.'
'I suppose I should take this potion too, hadn't I? Well, then. Preparations are nearly complete, I should say.'
Vaskorn has gone off to deal with the Ungoledain single-handedly and without protection from the poison. Threkmóth concedes this may have been a mistake.
TBD
Deliver Radagast's potion to Hunulf
Return to Threkmóth

'The smell is horrible, I confess, but it will do the trick. Take it, and you and Threkmóth's folk will be well-shielded while fighting the Ungoledain.

'Do be sure to consume it before you strike. I am far from certain of its powers to cure the poison after the fact.

'Now go, and fortune smile upon you.'
Deliver Radagast's potion to Fiskvat
You should return to Radagast, in the Thornholt woods, to collect the potion which will guard against the Ungoladan-poison.
Return to Threkmóth
'Your help is most welcome, [placeholder]. Vaskorn is my brother. I would have run off to stand by his side sooner, if I had known.'
#-1:[placeholder]'Your help is most welcome, #-1:{sister[f]|brother}. Vaskorn is my kin.  I would have run off to stand by his side sooner, if I had known.'
Get the potion from Radagast
'Threkmóth is not a bad sort, really, though sometimes I think he cares more for honey cakes than his folk, or anyone else for that matter.'
You should return once again to the Beorning camp of Skoghús, in the south of Thornholt, and let Threkmóth know you have Radagast's potion.
'I suppose I should take this potion too, hadn't I? Well, then. Preparations are nearly complete, I should say.'
You should return to Threkmóth, now that you have given Radagast's potion to Fiskvat and Hunulf.
You should deliver the poison protection to Fiskvat and Hunulf, Threkmóth's neighbours.
